title: Touro Synagogue National Historic Site: Park Home
body: The oldest synagogue in the United States  Touro Synagogue, a building of exquisite beauty and design, steeped in history and ideals, and one of the most historically significant Jewish buildings in America, was designated a National Historic Site in 1946.Â  Dedicated in 1763, it still serves an active congregation and each year greets over 30,000 visitors who come to see the magnificent interior and hear its remarkable story.              Things To Do Near Touro Synagogue   There are many things to see and do close to Touro Synagogue National Historic Site.
